title.narrative: Improving Access to Affordable Housing Project

description.narrative: The Project's development objective is to increase access to affordable housing for low-income beneficiaries.

condition.narrative: Section I.C.1 of Schedule 2 to the LA:For purposes of carrying out the Project, the Borrower, through SHCP and CONAVI (in itscapacity as the Project implementing entity), shall enter into a contract (Contrato de Mandato) with NAFIN, satisfactory to theBank.

Section I.D.2 (a) of Schedule 2 to the LA: Prior to the carrying out of any activity under Parts 1 and 2 of the Project, theBorrower shall ensure that CONAVI shall issue a notice (Oficio) acceptable to the Bank, which Oficio shall provide, inter alia,that: (a) any Executing Entity participating in the Project shall comply and ensure compliance with the transparency and governanceprovisions referred to in Section I. D.1 of the Loan Agreement; and (b) upon deposit of the Direct Support(s) by CONAVI in therelevant Executing Entity’s account, such deposit shall be interpreted as an acceptance of the Oficio’s transparency and governanceprovisions

Section I.E of Schedule 2 to the LA:The Borrower, through CONAVI, shall: (a) carry out the Project in accordance with the ESMF andthe IPP; and (b) cause each Executing Entity to: (i) carry out Part 1 of the Project in accordance with the ESMF and the IPP; and(ii) ensure that the OEOs shall carry out the activities under Part 2 of the Project in accordance with the ESMF and the IPP.Except as otherwise agreed by the Bank, the Borrower, through CONAVI, shall not amend, abrogate, waive, or fail to enforce the ESMFand IPP or any of their provisions.

title.narrative: Number of direct supports allocated to low-income beneficiaries
Training workshops carried out on: construction best practices; workers safety and security; local and culturally adequate design; and/or participatory planning, especially towards women
Percentage of beneficiaries from the informal sector
Percentage of direct supports allocated for beneficiaries below 2.6 UMAs
A community dissemination campaign targeting indigenous populations designed and implemented
An empowerment system for beneficiaries is designed and implemented
